title:
Classification of Single Photons in Higher-Order Spatial Modes via
  Convolutional Neural Networks
authors:
Manon P. Bart, Sita Dawanse, Nicholas J. Savino, Viet Tran, Tianhong
  Wang, Sanjaya Lohani, Farris Nefissi, Pascal Bass\`ene, Moussa N'Gom, Ryan T.
  Glasser
abstract:
Spatial modes are a promising candidate for encoding information for
classical and quantum optical communication due to their potential high
information capacity. Unfortunately, compensation of the wavefront upon
propagation through the atmosphere is necessary to benefit from advantages
spatial modes offer. In this work, we leverage the success of convolutional
networks in denoising and classifying images to improve information transfer of
spatial modes. Hermite-Gauss, Laguerre-Gauss, and Ince-Gauss modes are
experimentally generated using single photons and imaged. A denoising
autoencoder corrects for turbulence effects on the wavefront, followed by a
convolutional neural network to classify mode orders. The model achieves a
99.2% classification accuracy across all modes, and Hermite-Gauss modes
exhibited the highest individual mode accuracy. As the convolutional networks
rely solely on intensity, they offer an efficient and cost-effective tool for
optical communication systems in the single photon limit.
